General.Name: Boustead Plantations Bhd
General.Description: Boustead Plantations Berhad, an investment holding company, owns, operates, and manages oil palm plantations in Malaysia. The company operates through Plantation and Others segments. It cultivates oil palms; harvests its fresh fruit bunches; produces and sells crude palm oil and palm kernel; and farms, markets, and sells agriculture produces. The company also provides mill design and consultancy services; plantation management and engineering consultancy services; and advisory and research services on life sciences and commercialization of products. It manages 44 oil palm plantation estates, including 18 in Peninsular Malaysia, 20 in Sabah, and 6 in Sarawak with a combined land bank of 98,200 hectares; and 10 palm oil mills. The company was formerly known as Kuala Sidim Berhad and changed its name to Boustead Plantations Berhad in April 2004. The company was incorporated in 1946 and is headquartered in Petaling Jaya, Malaysia. Boustead Plantations Berhad is a subsidiary of Boustead Holdings Berhad.
